messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Dr Seuss--need article
messages.messageBody:

> Hi.
>
> Can anyone resend the url for the globe article about Dr. Seuss that was sent
> out a few days ago? I'd appreciate it, as my daughter is writing a kids' book
> about him. We deleted the message by mistake!
>
> Thanks!
>



http://www.globeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20031123.wseuss1123/BNStory/
Entertainment/

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Dr Seuss--need article
messages.msgSnippet: Hi. Can anyone resend the url for the globe article about Dr. Seuss that was sent out a few days ago?  I d appreciate it, as my daughter is writing a kids
messages.messageBody:
Hi.

Can anyone resend the url for the globe article about Dr. Seuss that was sent out a few days ago? I'd appreciate it, as my daughter is writing a kids' book about him. We deleted the message by mistake!

Thanks!

messages.subject: Re: Dr Seuss
messages.msgSnippet: ... definitely look it up! Why didn t you say that before!  We could have our next New England Unschoolers group there!  (It s close to me--muuuhhhhaaaaaaa.)
messages.messageBody:
"coyote's corner" <janis@c...> wrote:
> Thanks so much!! We go to or through Springfield often...I'll
definitely look it up!


Why didn't you say that before! We could have our next New England
Unschoolers group there! (It's close to me--muuuhhhhaaaaaaa.)

Crystal

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Dr Seuss
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks so much!! We go to or through Springfield often...I ll definitely look it up! Janis & Brianna ... From: kbcdlovejo@aol.com To:
messages.messageBody:
Thanks so much!! We go to or through Springfield often...I'll definitely look it up!
Janis & Brianna
----- Original Message -----
From: kbcdlovejo@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, November 25, 2003 8:51 AM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Dr Seuss


In a message dated 11/25/2003 3:37:29 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
Fenkl points to the ending as particularly charged, with the reader asked:
> "What would you do if your mother asked you?" Would you disclose the truth
> about the day, or conceal it? "Children who read this understand
profoundly
> the nature of this transgression," he argues. "They understand that the
> culture of children is actually quite different than that of adults, that
> there are things that you keep from adults."<<<<<<<



When we've read it, I've asked Duncan what HE would do.

He said that he'd tell me, OF COURSE, because he knows I would laugh at all
the funny things that happened (and then go check on the fish!). <BWG>

Oh----and if you're ever in Springfield, MA, you SHOULD go to the little
museum there. Geisel's daughter is a bronze sculptor and has sculpted all of the
characters from his books. They are planted all over the grounds. We have
photos of me and Duncan with the HUGE book of _Oh! The Places You Will Go_, The
Grinch, The Lorax----everybody! Really Cool!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
